data.title: Best Burger in Livonia
data.text: The Daly Burger is a Detroit classic, on a steamed/grilled bun with Daly's special sauce, sooooo good. Get a hot fudge shake made with chocolate ice cream and chocolate milk, great cole slaw, and fries. Can't. Be. Beat.

data.title: Memories and Friendships renewed
data.text:
Our Roosevelt-Robichaud High School Alumni have been making annual pilgrimages to the Daly (in Livonia, now that our favorite on Beech Daly, Dearborn Heights, no longer exists) to bring back old memories and renew friendships.  
Love the food, the service and the ambiance.  Come on down!

data.title: Great food & service!  Even carryout is excellent!
data.text: We've been going to Daly Drive-In for years!  Turns out it's the place where my husbands' grandfather & himself painted the drive-in many moons ago!  But that's not the reason we love it!  It's the food & service you receive while eating there!  The waitress are friendly, can joke around with you make you feel comfortable!  Thumbs up!!

data.title: A different burger place
data.text: First thing, they only take cash so be sure you have some on hand. I live near this place so I go there every now and then. Daly's is a classic burger joint my Dad used to go to when he was a teen in the 60's. The menu is unique. The food is good as is the service. Worth a look even if just a one time visit.

data.title: The only Daly restaurant left
data.text: I have been coming here for years. The food has gotten a bit more pricey but I still go a few times a year. The Daly sauce is a mixture of ketchup, mustard relish and other stuff and is similar to a chili sauce to me anyway. They have a few select dinners and malts and foot long coneys also. They also have a carhop area where you order from your car and the staff brings your food to you. Sorry no Roller Skate waitresses! They have a great salad bar and around 5 soups a day plus their chili.

data.title: Dissapointed
data.text: Used to love Daly's....came here for many years...many years ago. Just not as good as it used to be!!

data.title: Yummy.  Check it out.
data.text: We go to Daly Drive-In fairly regularly.  It is close to our house.  Good Burgers, Great Fries, Great Shakes, and a fair price.  The interior is definitely dated and dark, but it is clean, and the service is good.  My husband loves their Chili Cheese Fries.  My only gripe, is the lack of refills on soda on any size other than the Large.  Weird policy.  Also, you should be aware it is Cash Only at Daly, so you have to be prepared for that as well.  But we love them.  Especially the drive-in section, which is still open.

data.title: Get the Daly Habit
data.text: Good burgers and shakes.  Old tyme diner feel with full salad bar and daily soup specials.  Daly dog comes with chili, cheese and onions.  Good for all ages.

data.title: In the day it was a hopping place
data.text: This is what I call a mom and pop place.  Homemade food, soup is good.  I'm not a hot dog lover but there's are pretty good.  People I have gone with seem to like the Daly Burger with the Daly sauce...Homemade milkshakes, sundaes, banana splits... There are specials Mon thru Fri.... No credit cards, cash only, there is a ATM available if it's working. Oh, I like the salad bar and soup, if they don't have the soup you like ask server as they have more in the back.

data.title: Old fashioned burger fun!
data.text: Stop by after a little league game for a shake and a foot long.  Daly's is the real deal!  Cash only, so make sure you've got a couple of bucks in your pocket!

data.title: Nostalgic
data.text: Nothing has changed thru all the years, food and milkshakes and fries and service still excellent! You can even do the old time style drive in service. They sell souvenirs too, and you'll love their collection of Coca~Cola trays and signs.

data.title: Just Like Being Back In The 60's
data.text: Dining at the Daly Drive-In is just like being back in the 60's! Minus the dollar surcharge that we had to pay to get into their parking lot (prevented cruising). Food is just as I remember same as the décor!

data.title: This place brings back a lot of memories!
data.text: This is one of our regular stops when we get back to Michigan!  The food is hard to copy! The Chee Chee is our favorite!  The server that took our order if had it made with everything separate so we could get it back to Tennessee!  We got to enjoy it for days after!

data.title: Over 50 years of excellence!
data.text: Get the original foot longs from years ago. They haven't changed a bit. My favorite is the chee-chee burgers. The chili is awesome!

data.title: Give Me My "Daly" Bread and Burgers
data.text: Can't help but love this old timesy drive-in restaurant that also has a large indoor dining area.  The place is only one-half block from my house!  Great burgers.

data.title: Best burger
data.text: Hamburgers are great an this is old style drive in so lil dated outside. Hard to compete with Sonic. The daly burger is the one to try and their sauce is special!

data.title: Love it here!!!!!
data.text: Always love coming here, always has the best food. Salads are not so great its mainly just lettuce thrown in a bowl over watered and rinsed, but their daly dogs are the best.

data.title: Wish I lived closer!
data.text: I have visited on several occasions and have never been disappointed. The burgers with the the Daly sauce are great! I highly recommend the milk shakes.......made the way they should be.....sooooo good! They do offer drive in service and they have a very large dinning room which is kept spotless.......something of a rarity these days. Waitstaff is very friendly also. I only wished I lived closer so I could go more often!!

data.title: Oldie place but a goodie!
data.text: I used to work by this place over 30 years ago and ate their once a week.   They have some really good ham sandwiches, hot dogs, soups and great shakes.  Their prices are reasonable.   I wish I lived closer to one.  We had very good service and the staff was very friendly.  I plan on going back there really soon.

data.title: Some Things Never Change
data.text:
Came back to my old home town for a visit and felt the need to check out if any of the places I knew of as a kid was still around. Daly Drive-In has been here for 60 years and in many ways it hasn't changed.
We stuck with the basics; double cheeseburgers, chili, chili fries and regular fries.  The burgers were great, nothing fancy, just the way a cheeseburger is supposed to be.
Can't wait to go back, and by the way they only accept cash.
